001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.modal;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.base.AbstractComponentService;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.factory.ComponentFactory;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.log.LogUi;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebDriver;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebElement;
008import org.openqa.selenium.By;
009
010/**
011 * Implementation of the {@link ModalService} interface, providing functionality to check
012 * if modals are open, click modal buttons, retrieve textual content, and close modals.
013 * Extends {@link AbstractComponentService} to handle creation and retrieval of
014 * {@link Modal} instances.
015 *
016 * <p>This class uses {@link ModalComponentType} to identify modals in a UI automation
017 * framework, ensuring consistent interactions via containers and direct locators.
018 *
019 * <p>Method implementations delegate to an internally retrieved {@link Modal} object
020 * for each specified component type.
021 *
022 * <p>All public methods align with the contract defined by {@link ModalService},
023 * ensuring compatibility and standardization across different modal implementations.
024 *
025 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
026 */
027public class ModalServiceImpl extends AbstractComponentService<ModalComponentType, Modal>
028      implements ModalService {
029
030   private static final String CHECK_MODAL_OPENED = "Checking if modal %s is opened";
031   private static final String CLICK_BUTTON_WITH_TEXT_CONTAINER =
032         "Clicking button with text %s in modal %s using container";
033   private static final String CLICK_BUTTON_WITH_TEXT = "Clicking button with text %s in modal %s";
034   private static final String CLICK_BUTTON_WITH_LOCATOR = "Clicking button with locator %s in modal %s";
035   private static final String GET_MODAL_TITLE = "Getting title of modal %s";
036   private static final String GET_MODAL_BODY_TEXT = "Getting body text of modal %s";
037   private static final String GET_MODAL_CONTENT_TITLE = "Getting content title of modal %s";
038   private static final String CLOSE_MODAL = "Closing modal %s";
039
040   /**
041    * Constructs a new {@code ModalServiceImpl} with the provided {@link SmartWebDriver}.
042    *
043    * @param driver the {@link SmartWebDriver} used to interact with browser elements.
044    */
045   public ModalServiceImpl(SmartWebDriver driver) {
046      super(driver);
047   }
048
049   /**
050    * Creates and returns a {@link Modal} component instance based on the provided
051    * {@link ModalComponentType}.
052    *
053    * @param componentType the specific modal component type.
054    * @return a new {@link Modal} instance for the given component type.
055    */
056   @Override
057   protected Modal createComponent(ModalComponentType componentType) {
058      return ComponentFactory.getModalComponent(componentType, driver);
059   }
060
061   /**
062    * Checks whether the modal identified by the provided component type is currently open.
063    *
064    * @param componentType the modal component type.
065    * @return true if the modal is open, otherwise false.
066    */
067   @Override
068   public boolean isOpened(final ModalComponentType componentType) {
069      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_MODAL_OPENED, componentType));
070      return modalComponent(componentType).isOpened();
071   }
072
073   /**
074    * Clicks a button inside the modal, identified by its text, within the specified container.
075    *
076    * @param componentType   the modal component type.
077    * @param container       the container in which the button is located.
078    * @param modalButtonText the text of the button to click.
079    */
080   @Override
081   public void clickButton(final ModalComponentType componentType, final SmartWebElement container,
082                           final String modalButtonText) {
083      LogUi.step(String.format(CLICK_BUTTON_WITH_TEXT_CONTAINER, modalButtonText, componentType));
084      modalComponent(componentType).clickButton(container, modalButtonText);
085   }
086
087   /**
088    * Clicks a button inside the modal, identified by its text, without specifying a container.
089    *
090    * @param componentType   the modal component type.
091    * @param modalButtonText the text of the button to click.
092    */
093   @Override
094   public void clickButton(final ModalComponentType componentType, final String modalButtonText) {
095      LogUi.step(String.format(CLICK_BUTTON_WITH_TEXT, modalButtonText, componentType));
096      modalComponent(componentType).clickButton(modalButtonText);
097   }
098
099   /**
100    * Clicks a button inside the modal, identified by a locator.
101    *
102    * @param componentType      the modal component type.
103    * @param modalButtonLocator the locator of the button to click.
104    */
105   @Override
106   public void clickButton(final ModalComponentType componentType, final By modalButtonLocator) {
107      LogUi.step(String.format(CLICK_BUTTON_WITH_LOCATOR, modalButtonLocator, componentType));
108      modalComponent(componentType).clickButton(modalButtonLocator);
109   }
110
111   /**
112    * Retrieves the title text of the modal associated with the provided component type.
113    *
114    * @param componentType the modal component type.
115    * @return the title text of the modal, or an empty string if no title is present.
116    */
117   @Override
118   public String getTitle(final ModalComponentType componentType) {
119      LogUi.step(String.format(GET_MODAL_TITLE, componentType));
120      return modalComponent(componentType).getTitle();
121   }
122
123   /**
124    * Retrieves the body text of the modal associated with the provided component type.
125    *
126    * @param componentType the modal component type.
127    * @return the main body text of the modal, or an empty string if no body text is present.
128    */
129   @Override
130   public String getBodyText(final ModalComponentType componentType) {
131      LogUi.step(String.format(GET_MODAL_BODY_TEXT, componentType));
132      return modalComponent(componentType).getBodyText();
133   }
134
135   /**
136    * Retrieves the content title of the modal, if separate from the main title.
137    *
138    * @param componentType the modal component type.
139    * @return the content title, or an empty string if not present.
140    */
141   @Override
142   public String getContentTitle(final ModalComponentType componentType) {
143      LogUi.step(String.format(GET_MODAL_CONTENT_TITLE, componentType));
144      return modalComponent(componentType).getContentTitle();
145   }
146
147   /**
148    * Closes the modal identified by the provided component type.
149    *
150    * @param componentType the modal component type.
151    */
152   @Override
153   public void close(final ModalComponentType componentType) {
154      LogUi.step(String.format(CLOSE_MODAL, componentType));
155      modalComponent(componentType).close();
156   }
157
158   /**
159    * Retrieves or creates a modal for the specified component type.
160    *
161    * @param componentType the modal component type.
162    * @return an existing or newly created {@link Modal}.
163    */
164   private Modal modalComponent(final ModalComponentType componentType) {
165      return getOrCreateComponent(componentType);
166   }
167
168}
